title: Windows Shortcut Following (.LNK)
overview: The shortcut (file with the .lnk extension) can permit an attacker to read/write a file that they originally did not have permissions to access.
remediation: ::PHASE:Architecture and Design:STRATEGY:Separation of Privilege:EFFECTIVENESS::DESCRIPTION:Follow the principle of least privilege when assigning access rights to entities in a software system. Denying access to a file can prevent an attacker from replacing that file with a link to a sensitive file. Ensure good compartmentalization in the system to provide protected areas that can be trusted.::
